COMMENT_TX: Could have been 24, especially if with Estrella, a RHB, up
$Kell bats out of order, but Tigers obviously do not appeal.
$Hall singles batting out of turn, Tigers appeal and Hall is called out incorrectly. $Siebert, the batter after Kell in the correct lineup should be ruled out.

$Plate umpire Rommel rules Kell leads off third after consulting with other umps. $Had Siebert been ruled out, which was correct, Hayes should lead off the third. $With Hall being ruled out incorrectly, rules are not clear who should lead off. $Both managers protest based on wrong man leading off; Athletics withdraw theirs. $Tigers protest is denied on the incorrect reason that Hall's single should have $been allowed because the Tigers did not point out the wrong batter in time.
$Line drive breaks Benton's right leg, but he tries to stay in the game.
$Benton collapses fielding ball and is carried off the field.
Tiger C Swift hurts shoulder trying to make tag, leaves game later
Don't know for sure when Swift left game; hurt shoulder in 5th

$As Caster left the mound, he fired the ball toward the Chicago dugout, but missed, hitting the adjacent wall; the White Sox players charged onto the field and several of the Browns charged the Chicago dugout where they attacked White Sox batting practice pitcher Scheel whom they beat for several minutes, claiming he had  been riding them in a personal way all game; when that confrontation was broken up, the game resumed with no one being ejected; many fans came on the field and the game was delayed for several minutes; Scheel was carried to the clubouse for first aid; Several Browns were fined vy the league: Manager Sewell ($250) and players Caster, Sig Jakucki and Ellis Clary, $100 each
DWS: the FC in this inning is invented, but we need an unassisted DP by Siebert and I see no other way

DWS: I don't like this play, but he did not have hit or walk and there are no extra Chicago errors
